column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=I use a lot of different sources .
#Text=I think it would be difficult to rely solely — or even primarily — on Wikinews , because I do n't think it is yet particularly comprehensive ; I do n't know if it ever will be .
#Text=I 'd be interested to know what you think of that .
#Text=Wikinews may become comprehensive but it will be a difficult process in my opinion .
#Text=Do you think the reason for this is wikigroaning , such as more topics are written in focused areas rather than things of interest to the most people ?
#Text=I agree .
#Text=And I 'm not sure whether or not it should be a goal of the organization .
#Text=Can I talk for just a second about one of the ways I think news is changing ?
#Text=It is a " faster " project than Wikipedia .
#Text=I have never heard of wikigroaning , what an interesting word .
#Text=But it makes sense to me that Wikinews would reflect the interests of the people who edit it , which I imagine is one of the reasons it ( and the other WMF projects ) are successful .
#Text=( Again , the relevance-to-audience issue . )
#Text=But regarding news ... I think it used to be the case that there was X amount of shelf space for news — like , 40 pages of newsprint daily , or 22 minutes of television time .
#Text=So whether it was a busy news day or a slow news day , that was the amount of news that got created .
#Text=And professional journalism is still pretty much constructed that way .
#Text=So if a media outlet has a reporter in Johannesburg , they get a lot of news out of South Africa , whether or not anything particularly interested is happening there .
#Text=You have x shelf space and x resources .
#Text=What I think changes — theoretically — with Wikinews , is that you are freed of both those constraints .
#Text=You have limitless shelf space and very flexible resources .
#Text=Which means , in theory , that you can cover lots of stories when there are lots of stories to cover , and do very little , when there is n't much going on .
#Text=So I think this is very interesting .
#Text=And I think it has implications for the future of news .
#Text=People should consume news when there 's something interesting to read about .
#Text=And I think Wikinews has enormous potential on big stories .
#Text=I am very interested to see how that plays out .
#Text=You may be interested in What Wikinews is not , the first point , Wikinews is not Paper
#Text=Yes , precisely .
#Text=And when there is a big story , lots of people come here to help , I assume .
#Text=We got great cooperation on some big stories like the UK attacks , did big media notice ?
#Text=( Major explosions at UK oil depot , Coordinated terrorist attack hits London )
